Home → Recommendations & reviews → Booked Out podcast

Booked Out podcast

Booked Out is our monthly book recommendation podcast, from Woodbridge Library’s Kellie Dimmock, Richard Baker, Sheila Haskins and Sophie Green.

August 2014: The fabulous world of children’s books

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Aug 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Fault in Our Stars by John Green, The Enemy series by Charlie Higson and The Enchanted Wood by Enid Blyton as well as the works of Oliver Jeffers, Marcus Sedgwick, Holly Webb and Patrick Ness.

July 2014: Non-fiction ands its rise in popularity

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Jul 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Travels in West Africa by Mary Kingsley, Coming Up Trumps – A Memoir by Jean Trumpington, Toast: The Story of a Boy’s Hunger by Nigel Slater and Jane Austen by Claire Tomalin.

June 2014: Audiobooks

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Jun 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss Love, Nina by Nina Stibbe, Our Man in Havana by Graham Greene and The Goldfinch by Donna Tartt.

May 2014: Stories from childhood

Written by The Booked Out team · Published May 1, 2014

Sheila Haskins and guests discuss The Little Prince by Antoine Saint-Exupéry, Destination Moon by Herge, and The Outsiders by S.E. Hinton.

April 2014: Time slip

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Apr 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss Atonement by Ian McEwan, Restless by William Boyd, The Vanishing Act of Esme Lennox by Maggie O’Farrell, The Return by Victoria Hislop, Ferney by James Long, The King of Shadows by Susan Cooper and Life after Life by Kate Atkinson.

March 2014: The great detectives in literature and television

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Mar 1, 2014

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Georges Simenon’s - Maigret, Margery Allingham’s Albert Campion, the iconic Sherlock Holmes by Arthur Conan Doyle and Vera by Anne Cleeves.

February 2014: Book club special

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Feb 1, 2014

Sophie Green is joined by members of the Golden Age Book Group to discuss Ray Bradbury’s Fahrenheit 451.

January 2014: One step beyond

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Jan 1, 2014

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Time Machine by H.G. Wells, The Dispossessed by Ursula Le Guin, Cloud Atlas by David Mitchell and Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? by Philip K. Dick.

December 2013: Escapism

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Dec 1, 2013

Sophie Green and guests discuss The Cellist of Sarajevo by Steven Galloway, The Knife of Never Letting Go by Patrick Ness, Instructions for a Heatwave by Maggie O’ Farrell and Walking back to Happiness by Lucy Dillion.

November 2013: Rom com in film

Written by The Booked Out team · Published Nov 1, 2013

Kellie Dimmock and guests discuss Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, Mrs. Doubtfire, Groundhog Day and the Road Movies of Bob Hope and Bing Crosby.
